snippet: The new iPad will be Apple's first mobile device compatible with so-called fourth-generation LTE networks. The introduction of this feature will help Apple buck Android competition, but its main impact will be on the carriers as they build out the...
abstract: The new iPad will be Apple's first mobile device compatible with so-called fourth-generation LTE networks. The introduction of this feature will help Apple buck Android competition, but its main impact will be on the carriers as they build out the advanced network. The biggest potential loser may be Sprint.

headline.main: What LTE Means for Apple and the Wireless Industry
